net.openhft.chronicle.bytes

Interface Byteable<B extends BytesStore<B,U>,U>

  • Type Parameters:
    B - Bytes type
    U - Underlying type
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ByteableIntArrayValues, ByteableLongArrayValues, LongReference, TwoLongReference
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractReference, BinaryBooleanReference, BinaryIntArrayReference, BinaryIntReference, BinaryLongArrayReference, BinaryLongReference, BinaryTwoLongReference, EmbeddedBytes, GuardedNativeBytes, NativeBytes, NativeBytes.NativeSubBytes, OnHeapBytes, SubBytes, TextBooleanReference, TextIntArrayReference, TextIntReference, TextLongArrayReference, TextLongReference, UncheckedLongReference, VanillaBytes

    public interface Byteable<B extends BytesStore<B,U>,U>
    This Interface allows a reference to off heap memory to be reassigned.

    A reference to off heap memory is a proxy for some memory which sits outside the heap.

    • Method Summary

      • bytesStore

        void bytesStore(BytesStore<B,U> bytesStore,
                long offset,
                long length)
         throws IllegalStateException,
                IllegalArgumentException,
                BufferOverflowException,
                BufferUnderflowException
        This setter for a data type which points to an underlying ByteStore.
        Parameters:
        bytesStore - the fix point ByteStore
        offset - the offset within the ByteStore
        length - the length in the ByteStore
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException
        IllegalArgumentException
        BufferOverflowException
        BufferUnderflowException

      • offset

        long offset()
        Returns:
        The offset within the BytesStore (not the address)

      • address

        default long address()
              throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns:
        The absolute address
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if not set ot the underlying byteStore isn't native.

        the maximum size in byte for this reference.
